function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Isolation of the health research community from other sectors may hinder the understanding of climate impacts on public health.","Impact":"Lack of understanding of climate impacts may lead to misallocation of resources and increased risk to populations.","Mitigation":"Facilitate multi-sectoral collaboration and integration of health research with other sectors to improve understanding and resource allocation.","Technologies":"Data sharing platforms, interdisciplinary research methodologies, and collaboration tools.","People":"Health researchers, policymakers, urban planners, public health officials.","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"Lack of presence of health considerations in collaborative multi-sectoral efforts for climate change adaptation.","Impact":"Inadequate attention to health issues in urban development and climate change policies, leading to increased vulnerability of populations.","Mitigation":"Incorporate health considerations into multi-sectoral collaboration efforts and policy formulation for urban development and climate change adaptation.","Technologies":"Health impact assessments, integrated planning tools, data modeling and visualization tools.","People":"Urban planners, policymakers, public health officials, climate scientists.","Owner":"Local government, public health agencies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Inadequate resources for cities to manage health challenges arising from climate change.","Impact":"Cities may struggle to address the health impacts of climate change, resulting in increased health risks for residents.","Mitigation":"Optimize resources through multi-sectoral collaboration and use of mitigation strategies tailored to urban health challenges.","Technologies":"Smart city technologies, public health surveillance systems, urban infrastructure planning tools.","People":"City officials, public health professionals, urban planners, community leaders.","Owner":"City governments, public-private partnerships, health organizations."}]}
